meanings.definition: Avoid work or school by staying away or leaving early.
meanings.sent1: Tom decided to skive off school and go to the park instead.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to skive work on Fridays by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to skive off its responsibilities by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The student managed to skive through the day without getting caught.
meanings.sent5: The employee's constant skiving eventually led to getting fired.

meanings.definition: Cut thin slices off a piece of leather or rubber.
meanings.sent1: The cobbler had to skive the leather to make it thinner for the shoe.
meanings.sent2: He used a special tool to skive the rubber smoothly and evenly.
meanings.sent3: The skiving machine made it easy to cut precise slices of leather.
meanings.sent4: She watched in amazement as the craftsman skived the leather with precision.
meanings.sent5: The skived leather had a smooth texture perfect for the bag.

meanings.definition: A thin slice of leather or rubber cut off a larger piece.
meanings.sent1: She found a small skive of leather on the workshop floor.
meanings.sent2: The skive of rubber was too thin to be used for the project.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally dropped the skive while working on the shoe.
meanings.sent4: The cobbler needed a skive of leather to repair the strap.
meanings.sent5: The tiny skive of rubber was perfect for patching the hole.
